soratami

  • Oct 8, 2025
  • #108
❅ almost made it #5 ❅
❅ missing diamonds ❅

Just like this rate, the previous one was divided in two teams, Black Diamonds (me) and Blue Stars (@DJHazey), and in this post I'll be going over the three Black Diamonds artists that didn't make it to this edition. We had originally intended to have all twelve artists from the previous rate appear in this one, but in the end it wasn't meant to be, so let's go over why, and what their bops, basically 2 entries could have been.

First off, we have Mabel. At the time of the original rate Mabel was in her all-out dance pop diva era thanks to her sophomore album About Last Night..., but that didn't prove to last, and she has since returned to her original, more lowkey and R&B-leaning material. Now the stuff she has released recently has been great too, but it wouldn't really fit here. One song we did consider was the third and final single from About Last Night, Overthinking, which would have fit well, but we didn't think it was essential, and the not great male feature wouldn't have helped matters either, especially as the song list is otherwise devoid of those:




Up next, Raye. Raye had a wealth of boppy/dancey material to choose from in the previous rate, but it's safe to say her career has firmly gone in a completely different direction now. If we were to include a Raye song it would have likely been this Disclosure collab, which is very solid but didn't really evoke strong feelings from either host:



Another option would have been the recent mega-smash Prada, but we didn't really want to go there given it's a sped-up remix of another song, where Raye is only the featured act.


And lastly we have Rita Ora. Now Rita had an absolutely killer selection in the previous rate, which actually got my second highest average there - I Will Never Let You Down, Anywhere, Let You Love Me, Big and Bang, but it's fair to say her releases since haven't quite been on that level, and despite actually having a number of valid options to choose form, unlike with the previous two artists, there wasn't really anything we were dying to include, even if we would have liked Rita to be here. Now fast forward a few weeks and Rita has actually released her best song in a good while, a really excellent vibey bop which would have fit this rate like a glove. It was some unlucky timing, because had it been released a bit earlier it would have 100% made the rate:

​
 
Reactions: Maki, GimmeWork, Duppe and 7 others

DJHazey

he/him
  • Oct 10, 2025
  • #119
❊ almost made it #6 ❊
❊ falling star ❊

As @soratami stated, Blue Stars seemed to have gotten a substantially higher number of songs from artists in the previous rate than Black Diamonds did. Maybe we should've called Jade Sun Team Eternal Sun instead dd. Last time we rated Come Get & It, Slow Down, Good for You, Hands to Myself, and Fetish. I guess we didn't care as much about having male features last time! For as much as people always point to Revival as a time when Selena's whispering talents were fully realized, those songs (and Fetish) crashed out before the Top 40 and it was the Stars Dance songs that made it further, including Slow Down at #16 (which is honestly the most in-line with the spirit of this rate to be fair). Since then, we got Rare, which was commercially successful sure, but was anybody on Popjustice really praising it? I think I played everything on Revival at least 100 times and Rare, maybe 5?



The only song from that era that even somewhat makes sense for a rate like this is Boyfriend, but commercially it was overshadowed by Lose You to Love Me and the Title-Track, so does that make any sense for a song that isn't as good as anything in the last rate? Besides Rare, Selena has 100% just been releasing random collab singles that I couldn't tell you what half of them are or what they sound like. The only thing remotely interesting was Love On, which we had on the initial list of songs, but it quickly felt forced when a barrage of better material started rolling into our prospective line-up. Besides, as someone who was one of the OG stans of Demi and Selena, it feels right that Demi gets a crack at this, since she was left behind last time (It would've been Cool for the Summer for sure and then what to make up five songs?)



Since I mentioned Demi and her entry Fast, how good is It's Not That Deep going to be on 10/24 huh? Here All Night is absolutely incredible and came in just a bit too late or she might have two songs here.

​
 
Reactions: BubblegumBoy, Trouble in Paradise and soratami

  • Oct 10, 2025
